description: The Designing and Implementing a Server Infrastructure exam is the first of two exams required to obtain the Microsoft Certified Solutions Expert (MCSE) certification. This exam departs from the traditional pattern of "how" to perform tasks and instead focuses on "why" these things are done and “why” one would want to make certain decisions like use IPsec instead of PPTP or have four active directory domain controllers instead of one. This course covers topics ranging from server capacity planning and placement to active directory topology design. The typical viewer would be anyone involved in designing network solutions or working in a consulting role.
name: MCSE Windows Server 2012 - 70-413
subtitle: Designing and Implementing a Server Infrastructure

episodes.description: The Designing and Implementing a Server Infrastructure exam is the first of two exams required to obtain the Microsoft Certified Solutions Expert (MCSE) certification. This exam departs from the traditional pattern of "how" to perform tasks and instead focuses on "why" these things are done. This course covers topics ranging from server capacity planning and placement to active directory topology design. The typical viewer would be anyone involved in designing network solutions or working in a consulting role.
episodes.title: Overview of MCSE Windows Server 2012 (70-413)
episodes.transcript:
1
00:00:00,004 --> 00:00:04,994
[SOUND] The 70-413 exam is the first

2
00:00:04,994 --> 00:00:09,102
exam on the way to completing your

3
00:00:09,102 --> 00:00:17,188
Microsoft Certified Solutions
Expert Certificate, the MCSE.

4
00:00:17,188 --> 00:00:20,615
The MCSE is one of the most sought
after certifications from Microsoft and

5
00:00:20,615 --> 00:00:24,539
it's definitely one of the most well known
IT certifications throughout the entire

6
00:00:24,539 --> 00:00:28,110
industry so it's definitely
a target people are looking for.

7
00:00:28,110 --> 00:00:31,140
Microsoft has expanded the MCSE
quite a bit over the years so

8
00:00:31,140 --> 00:00:33,060
there's actually more than one track.

9
00:00:33,060 --> 00:00:36,590
Let's start and take a look at that real
quick before we dive into the nitty gritty

10
00:00:36,590 --> 00:00:37,730
details.

11
00:00:37,730 --> 00:00:40,830
I've got the Microsoft certification and
training page pulled up here and

12
00:00:40,830 --> 00:00:43,780
they're just showing all of
the different MCSE's that are available.

13
00:00:43,780 --> 00:00:46,770
There's the MCSE desktop infrastructure,
which is important for

14
00:00:46,770 --> 00:00:48,960
people who are going to be
supporting Windows 7 or

15
00:00:48,960 --> 00:00:52,940
Windows 8 desktops in a corporate or
large enterprise environment.

16
00:00:52,940 --> 00:00:57,110
They cover technologies based on deploying
hundreds of thousands of machines and

17
00:00:57,110 --> 00:00:58,490
maintaining them.

18
00:00:58,490 --> 00:01:02,520
But when you have that many desktops you
need servers to provide services and

19
00:01:02,520 --> 00:01:06,030
that's where the MCSE server
infrastructure comes in.

20
00:01:06,030 --> 00:01:11,460
Now, there is an MCSE for Windows Server
2012 as well as Windows Server 2008.

21
00:01:11,460 --> 00:01:13,240
So depending on which
certification you're looking for,

22
00:01:13,240 --> 00:01:15,560
you'll want to make sure you
choose the appropriate one.

23
00:01:15,560 --> 00:01:18,390
The ones here on IT Pro TV are built
around Windows Server 2012,

24
00:01:18,390 --> 00:01:22,580
we choose to do the newer
certification as opposed to the older.

25
00:01:22,580 --> 00:01:25,520
But you'll see that there are other ones
out there, like the private cloud, for

26
00:01:25,520 --> 00:01:28,740
setting up the system center solutions
that are available through Microsoft.

27
00:01:28,740 --> 00:01:32,820
There's enterprise devices and apps,
which focuses around mobile and

28
00:01:32,820 --> 00:01:33,910
some development.

29
00:01:33,910 --> 00:01:35,600
Data platform for databases.

30
00:01:35,600 --> 00:01:39,420
Business Intelligence for
using the data in the databases.

31
00:01:39,420 --> 00:01:42,708
We've got Messaging, which is for
Microsoft Exchange and collaboration.

32
00:01:42,708 --> 00:01:44,660
You got MSCE: Communication,

33
00:01:44,660 --> 00:01:48,790
which is built around the link server and
some of the voice over IP technologies.

34
00:01:48,790 --> 00:01:53,000
And then good old SharePoint, for
information exchange and handling.

35
00:01:53,000 --> 00:01:55,400
Quite a few different MCSEs.

36
00:01:55,400 --> 00:01:57,610
When someone out there says,
hey, I'm an MCSE.

37
00:01:57,610 --> 00:02:02,100
We have to follow it up with a question,
with great, what are you an MCSE in?

38
00:02:02,100 --> 00:02:04,240
Which one are you actually certified in?

39
00:02:04,240 --> 00:02:08,660
Well, we're tackling the most common one,
and that's server infrastructure.

40
00:02:08,660 --> 00:02:12,980
These are employees that will be
responsible for configuring and

41
00:02:12,980 --> 00:02:14,730
maintaining servers.

42
00:02:14,730 --> 00:02:17,580
Now, those servers might
be providing name look ups.

43
00:02:17,580 --> 00:02:21,760
It might be authentication, file servers,
print servers Email servers,

44
00:02:21,760 --> 00:02:23,250
who knows what they're providing.

45
00:02:23,250 --> 00:02:26,430
But the basic foundation is
the Microsoft Windows Server product, and

46
00:02:26,430 --> 00:02:27,890
we need to know the ins and outs of it,

47
00:02:27,890 --> 00:02:32,410
and that's what the MCSE Server
Infrastructure is all about.

48
00:02:32,410 --> 00:02:36,980
Now, MSCE Server Infrastructure, that's
the generic name for the certification.

49
00:02:36,980 --> 00:02:39,960
There's specific tests,
though, catered to whether or

50
00:02:39,960 --> 00:02:43,480
not you are doing Windows server 2012 or
Windows server 2008.

51
00:02:43,480 --> 00:02:47,530
If you are doing Windows server 2012,

52
00:02:47,530 --> 00:02:51,480
notice that there's five
different exams listed here.

53
00:02:51,480 --> 00:02:53,500
Most of these, you should already have.

54
00:02:53,500 --> 00:02:58,490
If you are pursuing the MCSC,
you have to get your MCSA first.

55
00:02:58,490 --> 00:03:02,940
Like the MCSC, there are several MSCAs,
you need the MCSA for

56
00:03:02,940 --> 00:03:04,870
Server Infrastructure for
Windows Server 2012.

57
00:03:04,870 --> 00:03:07,010
When you have the MCSA for

58
00:03:07,010 --> 00:03:11,540
Windows Server 2012 that's these three
exams right here, 410, 411, and 412.

59
00:03:11,540 --> 00:03:13,990
It's actually 70-410, 70-411, and 70-412.

60
00:03:13,990 --> 00:03:19,730
If you don't have your MCSA yet,
stop here.

61
00:03:19,730 --> 00:03:22,140
You don't need the MSCE videos just yet.

62
00:03:22,140 --> 00:03:23,710
Jump back to the MCSA, right?

63
00:03:23,710 --> 00:03:25,690
We've already filmed them
right here on ITProTV and

64
00:03:25,690 --> 00:03:28,980
you can start moving through
starting with 70-410.

65
00:03:28,980 --> 00:03:33,080
If you go out of order one of two
things is going to happen, all right?

66
00:03:33,080 --> 00:03:35,260
One, you'll get in over
your head very fast.

67
00:03:35,260 --> 00:03:37,860
When we start right here with 70-413,

68
00:03:37,860 --> 00:03:42,380
it's assumed you already have all the
knowledge from those first three shows.

69
00:03:43,440 --> 00:03:44,940
So that's problem number one.

70
00:03:44,940 --> 00:03:46,580
Problem number two is,
if you start here and

71
00:03:46,580 --> 00:03:50,510
you go pass this exam,
you will not get a certification for it.

72
00:03:50,510 --> 00:03:54,880
You cannot get your MCSE unless
you also have your MCSA.

73
00:03:54,880 --> 00:03:58,940
That's the starting point,
before you proceed to here.

74
00:03:58,940 --> 00:04:02,970
Now at 70-413 is this, designing and
implementing a server infrastructure and

75
00:04:02,970 --> 00:04:04,010
this is a really neat one.

76
00:04:04,010 --> 00:04:08,230
It's different than pretty much any
other show we've done on IT Pro TV.

77
00:04:08,230 --> 00:04:13,990
In 410, 411, and 412, you learn how
to do a ton of different things.

78
00:04:13,990 --> 00:04:16,000
How to set up the active directory.

79
00:04:16,000 --> 00:04:18,810
How to configure routing and
remote access.

80
00:04:18,810 --> 00:04:19,850
How to do all this stuff.

81
00:04:20,920 --> 00:04:23,750
But you never really address the why.

82
00:04:23,750 --> 00:04:27,230
Why would I choose to use
IPsec instead of PPTP?

83
00:04:27,230 --> 00:04:32,290
Why would I choose to use
network access protection?

84
00:04:32,290 --> 00:04:35,250
Why would I choose to have four
active directory domain controllers

85
00:04:35,250 --> 00:04:36,290
instead of one?

86
00:04:36,290 --> 00:04:39,070
Why would I choose to have five
domains instead of just having

87
00:04:39,070 --> 00:04:40,960
one domain in a single forest.

88
00:04:40,960 --> 00:04:42,530
Why do we make these decisions?

89
00:04:42,530 --> 00:04:45,470
Well that's what the 70-413 show covers.

90
00:04:45,470 --> 00:04:48,540
We take a look at a lot of
the different infrastructure,

91
00:04:48,540 --> 00:04:50,860
the things that were covered
in the other servers.

92
00:04:50,860 --> 00:04:54,760
And now we find out the why,
the design mechanisms that go behind this.

93
00:04:54,760 --> 00:04:57,240
How we make the right decisions.

94
00:04:57,240 --> 00:05:02,110
This is not a responsibility that
somebody new to IT is going to be doing.

95
00:05:02,110 --> 00:05:04,340
Nobody is going to hire somebody
right out of college and say,

96
00:05:04,340 --> 00:05:06,110
"hey can you design my network".

97
00:05:07,280 --> 00:05:11,080
Because if you choose a poor design
on day one it's going to have

98
00:05:11,080 --> 00:05:13,880
lasting ramifications for
the life of that network.

99
00:05:13,880 --> 00:05:15,340
You need somebody with experience and

100
00:05:15,340 --> 00:05:18,810
a deep understanding of how all
the different pieces interact.

101
00:05:18,810 --> 00:05:21,850
When you have that understanding,
you can create a very stable,

102
00:05:21,850 --> 00:05:23,760
very reliable design.

103
00:05:23,760 --> 00:05:26,710
That will give you a much better network
experience throughout the life of your

104
00:05:26,710 --> 00:05:27,680
technology.

105
00:05:27,680 --> 00:05:29,590
So, that's what's covered in 70-413.

106
00:05:29,590 --> 00:05:33,320
There is some implementation.

107
00:05:33,320 --> 00:05:36,050
There's a few technologies we cover in
there that weren't on the other exams and

108
00:05:36,050 --> 00:05:37,530
so we actually show those.

109
00:05:37,530 --> 00:05:40,580
But most of it is just discussing designs.

110
00:05:40,580 --> 00:05:44,880
Possible arrangements of technologies to
provide the best possible deployment and

111
00:05:44,880 --> 00:05:48,260
the different things we have to take
into account that influence our design.

112
00:05:48,260 --> 00:05:50,930
We have to make modifications
based on our current network.

113
00:05:50,930 --> 00:05:53,450
So it's really neat,
it's very conceptual, and

114
00:05:53,450 --> 00:05:58,150
it's all built around stuff you've already
learned, so I will just reiterate it here.

115
00:05:58,150 --> 00:06:02,070
It is really important that you complete
those first three certification exams

116
00:06:02,070 --> 00:06:04,868
before progressing to here.

117
00:06:04,868 --> 00:06:09,440
Now once 413 is done, you are ready to
move on to 414 the other part of MCSC for

118
00:06:09,440 --> 00:06:10,630
Windows Server 2012.

119
00:06:10,630 --> 00:06:14,890
And it's implementing an advanced
server infrastructure.

120
00:06:14,890 --> 00:06:18,750
You take some of those earlier services
and you extend them even further with some

121
00:06:18,750 --> 00:06:21,690
advanced functionality that's in there and
we even take a look at some other

122
00:06:21,690 --> 00:06:25,250
ones like active directory federation
services that are just much more

123
00:06:25,250 --> 00:06:29,340
complex than any of the technologies
deployed in the earlier shows.

124
00:06:29,340 --> 00:06:31,210
So, really neat stuff here.

125
00:06:31,210 --> 00:06:33,080
When you pass these two exams,

126
00:06:33,080 --> 00:06:37,520
If you already have your MCSA
you'll then be awarded the MCSE.

127
00:06:37,520 --> 00:06:40,970
And for most people,
that's where they stop with Microsoft.

128
00:06:40,970 --> 00:06:43,750
Microsoft does have a few
higher tier certifications,

129
00:06:43,750 --> 00:06:45,590
like the Microsoft Certified Architect.

130
00:06:45,590 --> 00:06:48,220
I know they were talking
about retiring that one, or

131
00:06:48,220 --> 00:06:50,480
the Microsoft Certified Master
was another one.

132
00:06:50,480 --> 00:06:53,280
But their still out there,
you can still achieve those.

133
00:06:53,280 --> 00:06:56,350
But they are just not very common they
are very, very difficult to get and so

134
00:06:56,350 --> 00:06:59,260
most people stop right
there with the M-C-S-E.

135
00:06:59,260 --> 00:07:01,380
But is that the end if you are learning?

136
00:07:01,380 --> 00:07:05,090
No, once you've completed that it's
a good idea to broaden your horizons.

137
00:07:05,090 --> 00:07:09,030
You likely are having to integrate to
products from other vendors like Linux or

138
00:07:09,030 --> 00:07:12,650
Mac OS and so you may extend out to
start learning about those platforms and

139
00:07:12,650 --> 00:07:14,790
deploying service with those technologies.

140
00:07:14,790 --> 00:07:17,870
So just keep that in mind as you move
through, while this might seem like

141
00:07:17,870 --> 00:07:21,830
the end of your certification path with
Microsoft, it may just be the beginning

142
00:07:21,830 --> 00:07:26,350
of you entering into other operating
systems, so always pay attention, look for

143
00:07:26,350 --> 00:07:29,430
the various resources that
are out there learn all you can.

144
00:07:29,430 --> 00:07:32,920
That's the piece of advice I always
give to people is, learn all you can.

145
00:07:32,920 --> 00:07:38,010
Because it never hurts to know additional
information it's always going to help.

146
00:07:38,010 --> 00:07:40,950
So that's basically what we're going
to be taking a look at in the 70-413.

147
00:07:40,950 --> 00:07:44,000
That design, that why, how we do things,

148
00:07:44,000 --> 00:07:48,170
and why they're done throughout
a Microsoft environment.

149
00:07:48,170 --> 00:07:51,060
That sounds like the right place for
you if you got your MCSA and

150
00:07:51,060 --> 00:07:53,760
you're ready to move into the MCSE and
stay tuned,

151
00:07:53,760 --> 00:07:56,940
because we've got the 70-413
episodes coming up next.

152
00:07:56,940 --> 00:08:00,050
If you need to tackle the MCSA or
some of the other content, make sure you

153
00:08:00,050 --> 00:08:02,890
jump over to those shows, because it's
all part of your IT Pro TV subscription,

154
00:08:02,890 --> 00:08:06,920
so just make sure you start in
the right place and move forward.

155
00:08:06,920 --> 00:08:10,520
Well best of luck on your exams and I'll
see you in the episodes coming up next.

156
00:08:10,520 --> 00:08:17,669
[MUSIC]

topics.title: Overview for MCSE Windows Server 2012 R2 (70-413)
Plan and deploy a server infrastructure
Design and implement network infrastructure services
Design and implement network access services
Design and implement an Active Directory infrastructure (logical)
Design and implement an Active Directory infrastructure (physical)
